analyzed: g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum zhabs kyis gnas ma nu ma rab rgyas spyan gnyis yang dag dmar //

original: g-yas pas mi rus phreng 'dzin g-yon pas kha ma bye pa'i autpala sngon po bsnams //
analyzed: g-yas pas mi rus phreng 'dzin g-yon pas kha ma bye pa'i autpala sngon po bsnams //

original: snying rje ro yis kun nas gang ba'i ljags bskyod bzhad mdzad ma //
analyzed: snying rje ro yis kun nas gang ba'i ljags bskyod bzhad mdzad ma //
translated: with a tongue moving, laughing, and filled with the taste of compassion,

analyzed: ri dags dgra bo'i yi ni pags pa'i na bza' 'chad ba mo //
translated: with the garment of a deer skin thrown over her shoulder,

analyzed: de lta'i sgrol mas mi shes mun pa gsod par byed par shog / dpal ldan gnyis med rdo rje yis //
translated: May that kind of Tara dispel the darkness of ignorance.

original: bla ma'i zhabs kyi chu skyes la //🔽btud de rol pas bas pa yis //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhabs kyi chu skyes la // btud de rol pas bas pa yis //
translated: Having bowed to the lotus feet of the guru🔽who is glorious, nondual Vajra,🔽I will explain the sadhana of Tara

original: sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs brjod par bya //
analyzed: sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs brjod par bya //
translated: with the remainder of my playfulness.

original: dang por re zhig sngags pas kha bshal ba la sogs pa byas te stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug nas me tog dri zhim po bkram pa'i sa phyogs su ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa bshams la /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sngags pas kha bshal ba la sogs pa byas te stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug nas me tog dri zhim po bkram pa'i sa phyogs su ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa bshams la /
translated: First, the mantrin, having performed mouth-rinsing and so forth, sits on a comfortable seat, sets out offerings of whatever is available in a place strewn with fragrant flowers,

original: rang gi snying gar h'um dkar po nye bar blta'o //🔽h'um dkar po de las rang gi ba spu'i bu ga dang / kha la @98a * //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar h'um dkar po nye bar blta'o // h'um dkar po de las rang gi ba spu'i bu ga dang / kha la @98a * //
translated: and views a white hum in his heart.

original: sogs pa'i sgo las 'od zer rnam pa lnga 'phro bar bsams te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgo las 'od zer rnam pa lnga 'phro bar bsams te /
translated: From that white hum, one imagines five-colored light rays radiating from one's pores and the doors of one's mouth and so forth.

original: 'od zer de dag gis gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas ba snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: 'od zer de dag gis gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas ba snang bar byas nas /
translated: Those light rays illuminate limitless world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

original: de nas 'og min na bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sku mdog la sogs pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de nas 'og min na bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sku mdog la sogs pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Then, the Bhagavatī who resides in Akaniṣṭha, endowed with the color of the body and so forth as will be explained,

original: gang yang bdag la gsol ba 'debs pa'i sems can de dag la byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa gcig car mdun na 'dug par bsams la /
analyzed: gang yang bdag la gsol ba 'debs pa'i sems can de dag la byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa gcig car mdun na 'dug par bsams la /
translated: is imagined to be seated in front, saying, “I will bless those sentient beings who supplicate me.”

original: de nas yi ge h'um las me tog bdug spos dri dang phreng ba la sogs pa spros pas mchod do ;
analyzed: de nas yi ge h'um las me tog bdug spos dri dang phreng ba la sogs pa spros pas mchod do ;
translated: Then, having emanated flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, and so forth from the syllable hūṃ, make offerings.

original: / de nas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / mchod pa dbul ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang /
analyzed: / de nas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / mchod pa dbul ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang /
translated: Then, one should perform loving kindness, compassion, joy, equanimity, offering the pūjā, confessing misdeeds, rejoicing in merit,

original: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: and going for refuge to the Three Jewels, and so forth.

original: aom badzra pushpe a'a:h'um zhes pas bsngags pa'i me tog la sogs pa ming spel dang bcas pas dbul lo //
analyzed: aom badzra pushpe a'a:h'um zhes pas bsngags pa'i me tog la sogs pa ming spel dang bcas pas dbul lo //
translated: Offer the flowers and so forth, which are consecrated with the mantra oṃ vajra puṣpe aḥ hūṃ, along with the extension of the name.

original: de nas bdag dang chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag dang chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should meditate on the emptiness of the nature of non-arising of oneself and all phenomena from the beginning.

original: aom sv'a bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sv'a bh'a wa shuddhonyaham /
analyzed: aom sv'a bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sv'a bh'a wa shuddhonyaham /
translated: Om svabhava shuddha sarva dharma svabhava shuddho ham.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'atma konyaham /🔽zhes brjod do //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'atma konyaham / zhes brjod do //
translated: Om shunyata jnana vajra svabhava atma ko ham.

original: de nas smon lam gyi dbang gis yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po dang / de'i dbus su yi ge tam yongs su gyur pa las thod pa nor bu chu shel lta bu'i 'od can khrag gis yongs su gang ba /
analyzed: de nas smon lam gyi dbang gis yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po dang / de'i dbus su yi ge tam yongs su gyur pa las thod pa nor bu chu shel lta bu'i 'od can khrag gis yongs su gang ba /
translated: Then, by the power of aspiration, one should transform the letter A into a red lotus and in its center transform the letter Tam into a skull-cup, the color of a crystal jewel, filled with blood.

original: de'i dbus su yi ge h'um dkar po 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su yi ge h'um dkar po 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: In its center is a white letter Hum with five light rays.

original: shin tu mdzes pa de yongs su gyur pa las autpala sngon po kha ma bye ba yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlabs par bltas la /
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa de yongs su gyur pa las autpala sngon po kha ma bye ba yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlabs par bltas la /
translated: One should visualize that very beautiful letter transforming into an unopened blue lotus, consecrated by the letter Hum.

original: de dag yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma'i sku zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
analyzed: de dag yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma'i sku zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
translated: They completely transform into one’s own form as Bhagavatī, with one face and two arms.

original: sku mdog dkar mo stag gi pags pa'i smad dkris can phyag g-yas pas mi rus kyi phreng ba 'dzin pa /
analyzed: sku mdog dkar mo stag gi pags pa'i smad dkris can phyag g-yas pas mi rus kyi phreng ba 'dzin pa /
translated: Her body is white, with a lower garment of tiger skin, and she holds a human-bone rosary in her right hand.

original: g-yon na autpala sngon po kha ma bye ba bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon na autpala sngon po kha ma bye ba bsnams pa /
translated: In her left hand she holds an unopened blue utpala flower.

original: ral pa kham pa gyen du brdzes pa tshangs pa'i gnas kyi bar du shin tu khyab pa /
analyzed: ral pa kham pa gyen du brdzes pa tshangs pa'i gnas kyi bar du shin tu khyab pa /
translated: Her tawny hair swirls upward and spreads as far as the realm of Brahmā.

original: klu gdug pa can brgyad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: klu gdug pa can brgyad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with the eight nāgas.

original: karko ta sngon @98b pos thod byas pa /
analyzed: karko ta sngon @98b pos thod byas pa /
translated: Kārttikeya, blue, serves as her head ornament.

original: 'jog po dmar po'i do shal can /
analyzed: 'jog po dmar po'i do shal can /
translated: Takṣaka, red, serves as her necklace.

original: dga' bo dang nye dga' bo ser po dag gis rna cha dag dang ldan pa //
analyzed: dga' bo dang nye dga' bo ser po dag gis rna cha dag dang ldan pa //
translated: Airāvata and Airāvaṇa, yellow, serve as her earrings.

original: mtha' yas dkar po'i tshangs skud can /
analyzed: mtha' yas dkar po'i tshangs skud can /
translated: Ananta, white, serves as her sacred thread.🔽Vāsuki, white, serves as her belt.

original: nor rgyas dkar po'i ska rags dang // dung skyong dkar pos phyag gdub byas pa /
analyzed: nor rgyas dkar po'i ska rags dang // dung skyong dkar pos phyag gdub byas pa /
translated: Śaṅkhapāla, white, serves as her bracelets.

original: padma dang padma chen po dmar pos zhabs gdub byas pa /
analyzed: padma dang padma chen po dmar pos zhabs gdub byas pa /
translated: Padma and Mahāpadma, red, serve as her anklets.

original: do shal dang / zhabs gdub dang / dbu rgyan dang / se ral khas brgyan pa /
analyzed: do shal dang / zhabs gdub dang / dbu rgyan dang / se ral khas brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with a necklace, anklets, a head ornament, and a sacred thread.

original: zhabs g-yas brkyang zhing g-yon bskum pas ro'i steng du gnas pa /
analyzed: zhabs g-yas brkyang zhing g-yon bskum pas ro'i steng du gnas pa /
translated: He stands on a corpse with his right leg straight and his left leg bent.

original: shin tu 'jigs su rung ba zhal mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa /
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs su rung ba zhal mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa /
translated: He is very frightening, with slightly bared fangs.

original: ljags 'dril ba /
analyzed: ljags 'dril ba /
translated: He has a curled tongue.

original: dpal mi bskyod rdo rje'i cod pan gyis spyi bor brgyan pa /
analyzed: dpal mi bskyod rdo rje'i cod pan gyis spyi bor brgyan pa /
translated: His head is adorned with a crown of glorious Akṣobhya.

original: byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i sems dang ldan pa cig bsgom mo //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i sems dang ldan pa cig bsgom mo //
translated: He has a mind of great love and compassion.

original: rang gi snying ga'i h'um dkar po'i 'od zer gyis ye shes sems ma'i dkyil 'khor dgug par bltas te /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i h'um dkar po'i 'od zer gyis ye shes sems ma'i dkyil 'khor dgug par bltas te /
translated: One should visualize that light rays from the white hūṃ in one’s heart invoke the awareness beings of the mandala.

original: de nas dza:h'um bam ho: zhes pa dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nas dza:h'um bam ho: zhes pa dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba ste /
translated: Then, with jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, one should visualize that they are invoked, enter, are bound, and are controlled,

original: ye shes sems ma dang chu dang 'o ma 'dres pa ltar dbyer med par blta'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems ma dang chu dang 'o ma 'dres pa ltar dbyer med par blta'o //
translated: and that the awareness beings and the pledge beings are inseparable, like water poured into water.

original: de nas rje btsun ma'i thugs ka'i padma'i steng du yi ge hr'im shel dag pa'i mdog lta bur 'od zer brgya stong 'phro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rje btsun ma'i thugs ka'i padma'i steng du yi ge hr'im shel dag pa'i mdog lta bur 'od zer brgya stong 'phro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the lotus above the heart of the Exalted Goddess of Wisdom, one should visualize the syllable HRĪḤ, the color of pure crystal, radiating hundreds of thousands of light rays.

original: bsgoms pa las dub na sngags don dang ldan pa gzhal du med par myur bar dang / bul ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / mtshang ba spangs nas yid kyis dmigs te bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las dub na sngags don dang ldan pa gzhal du med par myur bar dang / bul ba dang / mi gsal ba dang / mtshang ba spangs nas yid kyis dmigs te bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When one is tired of meditating, one should recite the mantra with the mind, endowed with the meaning of the mantra, an immeasurable number of times, quickly, slowly, indistinctly, and with faults.

original: de la sngags btu ba ni sde tshan bdun pa'i bzhi pa la mes yang dag par ldan pa'i yi ge ai yis brgyan cing zla tshes dang thig les mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sngags btu ba ni sde tshan bdun pa'i bzhi pa la mes yang dag par ldan pa'i yi ge ai yis brgyan cing zla tshes dang thig les mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the extraction of the mantra is as follows: The fourth of the seventh group, endowed with fire, adorned with the syllable I, beautified with the crescent moon and the drop.

original: ji ltar 'dod pas bzlas pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pas bzlas pas so //
translated: One should recite it as one wishes.

original: lte ba'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad kyi steng du yi ge h'um shin tu 'bar ba blta'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad kyi steng du yi ge h'um shin tu 'bar ba blta'o //
translated: In the center of the navel, on an eight-petaled lotus, one should visualize the syllable HŪṂ, blazing intensely.

original: de nas phreng ba'i rdog po rnams yi ge hr'im gi gzugs su bltas la /
analyzed: de nas phreng ba'i rdog po rnams yi ge hr'im gi gzugs su bltas la /
translated: Then, one should visualize the beads of the rosary in the form of the syllable HRĪḤ.

original: de rgyun ma chad par rang gi kha nas 'thon te lte ba'i lam du zhugs shing kha nas byung bar bsams la /
analyzed: de rgyun ma chad par rang gi kha nas 'thon te lte ba'i lam du zhugs shing kha nas byung bar bsams la /
translated: That [syllable] emerges continuously from one's mouth, enters the path of the navel, and emerges from the mouth.

original: sngags kyi rgyal po yig 'bru gcig po 'dis yid bzhin nor bu ltar sdig pa dang yams thams cad 'jig pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / @99a * //
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po yig 'bru gcig po 'dis yid bzhin nor bu ltar sdig pa dang yams thams cad 'jig pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / @99a * //
translated: One should recite this king of mantras, the one-syllable [syllable], which is like a wish-fulfilling gem, destroying all negativities and epidemics, bringing under control,

original: dbab pa dang 'gro ba 'khrug par byed pa'i sngags sangs rgyas kyi gsung blo gros brtan pas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: dbab pa dang 'gro ba 'khrug par byed pa'i sngags sangs rgyas kyi gsung blo gros brtan pas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: and causing the mantras that bring about descent and the agitation of beings to be recited by the Buddha's speech, Sthiramati.

original: 'di lta bu'i sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pas snyan dngags mkhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pas snyan dngags mkhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting this mantra one hundred thousand times, one will become a poet.

original: 'dzin par nus pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i tshig dang ldan pa dang / nor che ba dang / tshe ring ba dang / bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par nus pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i tshig dang ldan pa dang / nor che ba dang / tshe ring ba dang / bstan bcos thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be able to retain [the teachings], have vajra-like speech, be wealthy, have a long life, and become learned in all treatises.

original: khyung gi dbang po ltar srid pa gsum gyi dug med par byed pa dang / myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: khyung gi dbang po ltar srid pa gsum gyi dug med par byed pa dang / myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bar gdon mi za'o //
translated: Like the king of garuḍas, it removes the poisons of the three existences, and one will undoubtedly quickly attain unsurpassed awakening.

original: aom a'a:hr'im h'um ham ha /
analyzed: aom a'a:hr'im h'um ham ha /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hrīṃ hūṃ haṃ ha.

original: zhes ba'i sngags kyi rgyal po 'dis sangs rgyas nyid kyang sbyin par byed na dngos grub gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: zhes ba'i sngags kyi rgyal po 'dis sangs rgyas nyid kyang sbyin par byed na dngos grub gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: By this king of mantras, one will attain even buddhahood, let alone other powers.

original: aom a'a:hr'im h'um gh'a ta ya sarba bighn'an h'um phad sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom a'a:hr'im h'um gh'a ta ya sarba bighn'an h'um phad sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hrīṃ hūṃ ghaṭaya sarva vighnān hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: sngags 'dis gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'dis gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With this mantra, one should offer the bali.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ral pa gcig ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ral pa gcig ma dkar mo'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Sādhana of White Ekajaṭī

original: dpal gnyis med rdo rje las byung ba slob dpon rol pa'i sbas pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal gnyis med rdo rje las byung ba slob dpon rol pa'i sbas pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The glorious one arisen from the vajra of nonduality, composed by Ācārya Lalitavajra, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar shar phyogs pa rendra j'i ga ta la'i pandi ta chen po d'a na sh'i las yul dbus kyi grub pa thob pa'i gnas drang srong srin por ri bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar shar phyogs pa rendra j'i ga ta la'i pandi ta chen po d'a na sh'i las yul dbus kyi grub pa thob pa'i gnas drang srong srin por ri bsgyur ba'o /
translated: By the great Indian paṇḍita Dānaśīla, in the land of Magadha, the place of siddhas, at Ṛṣivimokṣa Hill.
